text: Hi everyone, I have 2 environment (dev and prod) in HubSpot, I need migrate my tables of dev to prod, but this tables has foreign keys, how I can keep the relationship between tables

does anyone know how to pass a hubDB image into a custom module?  i have an image field, and tried following the directions of this link (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/HubL-How-to-set-image-field-params-on-custom-widget/td-p/176871>) but still no luck
We cannot maintain the relationship at this time.. Need to re-enter in the new table.
Can u DM link to your code?
<https://app.HubSpot.com/design-manager/5631657/code/14649101624>
line 33
hi <@UG52C29EE> have you had a time to look at this?
can u try r.image.url?
Also the link above says `image` field did not work. So try `image_src` as well as he mentioned
i did try r.image.url ... didn't work either
the link above says to try r.image_src, r.image_width, etc.
it claims that if you had a field called image, that hubl would auto create image_src, <field name>_src, etc.
For now, may be hardcode width etc to see if it works first
i tried hard coding it didn't work either
i can't find anywhere how to read in an image other than to manually build our the image tag and passing image.url to the href
but i need to be able to pass image into my custom module because my custom module has all kinds of rules on what it does with the image
does that make sense?  is there some function perhaps i'm now aware of that will generate an image from src, width and height?
I am not sure if hubdb returned image value can be directly assigned to module image field
each time a row is created it generates a new `hs_id` so you have to reconnect them. I have a couple spreadsheet formulas that mostly automates this process DM me if you would like them
<@UG52C29EE> THANK YOU SO MUCH!
that worked!
I imagine eventually we will be able to use something else besides the `hs_id` to link them together on import
